workflow.name: Automate daily Hindu festival posts on X with Google Gemini and GPT-4o Mini ü§ñ
workflow.description:
## ‚ú® Automate Daily Hindu Festival Posts on X (Twitter) with AI üê¶

This workflow automates the entire process of creating and publishing culturally rich social media content about Hindu festivals. It starts by building a comprehensive festival calendar for the year in a Google Sheet, then runs daily to post engaging, bilingual updates on X (formerly Twitter). üóìÔ∏è

The workflow uses a sophisticated dual-AI system: **Google Gemini** acts as a content generator creating multiple post options ‚úçÔ∏è, while **OpenAI's GPT-4o Mini** acts as a discerning social media manager, selecting the very best post for publication. üß† This ensures your content is not only automated but also high-quality and optimized for engagement.

### How it works ‚öôÔ∏è

This workflow operates in two distinct stages:

**Part 1: Data Population (One-Time Manual Run)**

1.  **üîç Fetch Festival Data:** Manually trigger the workflow to scrape a list of 2025 Hindu festivals from a public calendar using the [Jina AI Reader API](https://jina.ai/reader/).
2.  **‚ú® Enrich with AI:** For each festival, a **Google Gemini** model researches and extracts key details:
      * The festival's name in Hindi.
      * A concise description of its significance in English.
      * A Hindi translation of the description.
3.  **üìù Store in Google Sheets:** The enriched data for the entire year is then systematically organized and saved in a designated Google Sheet, creating a content calendar.

**Part 2: Daily Automated Posting**

1.  **‚è∞ Daily Trigger:** A Schedule Trigger node activates the workflow every morning at 8 AM.
2.  **‚úîÔ∏è Check for Festivals:** The workflow gets today's date and checks the Google Sheet to see if there is a corresponding festival.
3.  **üé® Generate Post Options:** If a festival is scheduled for the day, **Google Gemini** generates three distinct and engaging post options for X. Each post is crafted to be concise, use a mix of English and Hindi, and include relevant emojis and hashtags.
4.  **üèÜ Select the Best Post:** **OpenAI's GPT-4o Mini** then evaluates the three generated posts based on criteria like clarity, engagement potential, and effective use of language. It selects the single most impactful post.
5.  **üöÄ Publish to X:** The winning post is automatically published to your connected X account.

### Features ‚≠ê

  * **ü§ñ Fully Automated Content Pipeline:** From data collection to final publication, no manual intervention is needed after the initial setup.
  * **üß† Dual-AI System:** Leverages Google Gemini for creative generation and OpenAI GPT-4o Mini for critical selection, ensuring high-quality output.
  * **üó£Ô∏è Bilingual Content:** Creates posts that blend English and Hindi to enhance cultural connection and broaden audience reach.
  * **üéØ Dynamic and Contextual:** Posts are automatically tailored to the specific festival of the day.
  * **üóìÔ∏è Centralized Content Calendar:** Uses Google Sheets as a reliable, easy-to-manage database for your yearly social media plan.

### Prerequisites üõ†Ô∏è

Before you can use this workflow, you will need to:

  * Have an [n8n](https://n8n.io/) instance set up.
  * Create a new, empty **Google Sheet**.
  * Obtain credentials for the following services:
      * **Jina AI:** Get a free Bearer Token from the [Jina AI API page](https://jina.ai/reader/).
      * **Google:** Set up [Google credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/google/) (OAuth2) for the Google Sheets and Google Gemini nodes.
      * **OpenAI:** Get an API key from your [OpenAI Platform dashboard](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys).
      * **X (Twitter):** Set up [X credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/twitter/) (OAuth2) to allow n8n to post on your behalf.

### How to use this template üöÄ

1.  **üîë Set up Credentials:**
      * In n8n, go to the "Credentials" section and add new credentials for Jina AI, Google (for both Sheets and Gemini), OpenAI, and X using the API keys and tokens you obtained.
2.  **üìä Configure the Google Sheet:**
      * Create a new Google Sheet. In the first row, create the following headers exactly as written:
          * `Name of the Festival`
          * `Date`
          * ` English Description  ` (Note the trailing space)
          * `Hindi Description`
      * Open the **"Add all Rows at once"** and **"Fetch Data of Matched Date"** nodes in the workflow and connect them to your Google account and select the Sheet you just created.
3.  **‚ñ∂Ô∏è Populate the Data (Manual Step):**
      * Click the **"Execute workflow"** button on the `When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô` node. This will run the first part of the workflow, filling your Google Sheet with festival data for 2025. This only needs to be done once.
4.  **‚úÖ Activate the Workflow:**
      * Save the workflow and then activate it using the toggle at the top right of the n8n canvas.
      * The workflow will now run automatically every day to post about the day's festival.

### Extending the Workflow üí°

  * **üñºÔ∏è Add Image Generation:** Integrate a node like DALL-E or Midjourney to generate a unique image for each festival and include it in the tweet.
  * **üåê Cross-Platform Posting:** Duplicate the final "Post to X" node and adapt it to post on other platforms like Facebook, LinkedIn, or Telegram.
  * **üé® Change the Tone:** Modify the prompts in the **"Generate Posts"** and **"Select Best Post"** nodes to change the style of your social media content‚Äîmake it more formal, humorous, or poetic.
  * **üìÖ Use a Different Year:** Update the URL in the **"Get Festival Data"** node to fetch data for a different year. The current URL is `https://r.jina.ai/https://www.calendarlabs.com/2025-hindu-calendar`.

parameters.text:
=You are an expert Hindu festival researcher and data extractor. Your primary goal is to gather detailed information for each Hindu festival in 2025 based on the provided initial data.
Input Data:
Below is the content of the 'data' field, which contains a list of Hindu festivals for 2025 in a Markdown table format.
---
{{ $json.data }}
---
Your Task:
1.  Initial Extraction: First, meticulously parse the Markdown table titled "List of Religious Holidays of Hindu in 2025" from the Input Data. For each row, extract the English Name of the Festival (from the 'HOLIDAY' column, including all names if separated by '/') and the Date of the Festival (from the 'DATE' column, e.g., 'Jan 15, 2025').
2.  Date Formatting: Convert the extracted date to DD/MM/YYYY format. For example, 'Jan 15, 2025' should become '15/01/2025'.
3.  Information Enrichment : For each festival identified in Step 1,find the following additional details:
    Hindi Name of the Festival: Search specifically for the Hindi name (e.g., "Makar Sankranti Hindi name"). Prioritize widely accepted Hindi transliterations.
    **Short Description of the Festival: Find a concise, well-summarized English description (2-4 sentences is ideal) of the festival's significance, rituals, and celebration.
    *Hindi Description of the Festival/or translation of english to hindi:** Find a concise, well-summarized Hindi description (2-4 sentences is ideal) of the festival's significance, rituals, and celebration or just translate English description to Hindi.

=You are a social media content creator specializing in cultural and festival updates for X (formerly Twitter). Your goal is to create engaging posts that resonate with a diverse audience by blending English with key Hindi terms.

**Input Festival Data:**
-   **Festival Name:** `{{ $json["Name of the Festival"] }}`
-   **Date:** `{{ $json["Date"] }}`
-   **English Description:** `{{ $json["English Description "] }}`
-   **Hindi Description:** `{{ $json["Hindi Description"] }}`

**Your Task:**

Generate exactly 3 distinct social media post options for X (Twitter) for the `{{ $json["Name of the Festival"] }}` festival happening on `{{ $json["Date"] }}`.

**Guidelines for X (Twitter) Posts:**
1.  **Conciseness:** Keep posts brief and impactful, suitable for X's character limits.
2.  **Language Blend:** The primary language of the post should be English, but **strategically incorporate 1-3 relevant Hindi words or short phrases** (e.g., festival names, key ritual terms, or greetings from the Hindi Description) to enhance cultural connection and reach.
3.  **Engagement:** Encourage likes, retweets, or community interaction.
4.  **Hashtags:** Include 2-4 relevant and trending hashtags (mix of broad and specific, including some in Hindi where appropriate).
5.  **Emojis:** Incorporate 1-3 relevant emojis to enhance visual appeal.
6.  **Call to Action (Optional):** Suggest a simple call to action (e.g., "Retweet if...", "Learn more...").
7.  **Key Info:** Ensure the festival name and date are clearly visible.
8. **LIMIT:** The Character limit is 280 characters so text+hashtags+call_to_action should be less than 280

nodes.name: Transform to add all Data at once

parameters.content:
## üü• Execute workflow
Trigger node to manually run the workflow on demand for quick testing or use.

## üü™ Get Festival Data
- Makes a GET request to fetch festival data from a remote API. This acts as the external data source.

- **[URL](https://r.jina.ai/https://www.calendarlabs.com/2025-hindu-calendar)**

## üîó Generate Structured Data 
Uses an AI model (OpenAI or Gemini) to structure raw festival data into a well-defined format for consistent downstream processing.

## üüß Transform Data
JavaScript/Code node that reshapes structured output into the format required for Google Sheets (i.e., an array of rows).

## üü© Feel Google Sheet
Appends all transformed rows to a Google Sheet in one go. Efficient batch upload to keep data organized and update logs or reports.

## üîÅ  Everyday Trigger
Schedules the workflow to run automatically once every day to generate and publish a new post based on the date.

## üìÜ Get Today's Date
JavaScript code to fetch today's date.

## üü© Match Date
Reads a Google Sheet and filters the row(s) matching today‚Äôs date. Acts as the source of contextual data for the post.

## üß† Generate Posts
Uses an AI model (e.g., Gemini or OpenAI) to generate multiple draft social media posts based on the matched row‚Äôs content.

## üß† Select Best Post
Uses a second AI model to evaluate and select the best-performing or most relevant post among the generated options.

## üê¶ Post to X (Twitter)
Shares the chosen post directly to an X (formerly Twitter) account using the n8n X node.

main.node: Transform to add all Data at once
